intro: Tetrameles, commonly known as the ghost gum, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its unique, gnarled appearance and aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Tetrameles species are typically evergreen shrubs or small trees with rough, fissured bark. They are adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making them resilient to drought conditions.
